reviews.text: Our trip was July 3-10, 2012.
reviews.title: Wonderful family trip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband, and my two daughters aged 10 and 16 stayed at the Barcelo Maya Beach Resort. When we arrived at the airport we quickly found our Best Day Travel Representative who quickly took us in a 15 passenger van to the Barcelo. The driver was very professional and friendly.
reviews.title: Loved this resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival at the Barcelo. I had read in the reviews to upgrade when we got there and that is what we did. We asked for the premium package which gave us access to the Colonial and Tropical resorts, their restaurants but most importantly their air conditioned buffet. The Maya Beach Buffet is not air conditioned and you really notice the difference. It is just a 8 minute walk or so to the Colonial but well worth it because it was very hot and humid. The walk is not that bad as the grounds are very beautiful.
reviews.title: place to relax or party... u choose !!

reviews.text: The Room:
reviews.title: HUGE Resort!!!

reviews.text: Our room was 3308 in the Uxmal Building. We were as close to the beach as you could possibly get and we had a pool/partial beach view. The view was beautiful. Because we were a family of four our room was a little crowded. Thank goodness there was a little couch that converted into a small bed for our 10 year old. That made things much better. One little tip>>> When you get into your room, you must use your key card to start the air conditioning. It is not on if your key is not in in the slot. We got 2 keys for our room and placed one of them in the slot so that the air would be on the whole day. It would be suffocating if you don't do this.
reviews.title: Standard all inclusive

reviews.text: This resort is an hour's ride from the airport, seems a little far at first but it's not bad at all. Very friendly driver, and we made quick friends with the others on the bus. Ended up spending most of the week together!
reviews.title: No Complaints, fantastic vacation!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds are beautiful, excellently maintained. Watch out for the iguanas! So strange to see these guys everywhere, but they are harmless and run away when you walk past.
reviews.title: Huge resort, Nice beach, Bad food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was great, standard but very clean. Nice and cool always, and the maid service is very respectful and efficient.
reviews.title: Barcelo Maya Beach

reviews.text: Food was decent, nothing to complain about really...there are lots of options and every night they have a different theme...Italian, Seafood, Mexican. I really don't go on vacation thinking about the food, I'm most concerned with the beach and the pools.
reviews.title: Omg.....Amazing 2weeks June 2-16

reviews.text: This is an incredibly beautiful location, clean sandy beach, lots of chairs to lie on, someone comes around to collect your used cups. It was paradise!
reviews.title: Nice, but know these facts...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stay in nothing less than 4 star hotels through out the Caribbean. Especially in Mexico. The grounds of this hotel are incredible definitely 4 star and up. The beach is the best we have encountered and that says a lot. Snorkeling off the beach is great I saw sting rays, lots of fish and reef. I am a diver so that's saying a lot. I found a conch shell just a few hundred yard from the shore. I dove 4 times with the on site dive operation. It was better than expected for Riviera Maya, slightly more expensive than operations in puerto aventuras . They are professional and worked hard to accommodate my diving preferences. The rooms are average for a 4 star. comes with a mini bar and a balcony. :Loved the mini golf on site and all the amenities.
reviews.title: Very Good, not perfect

reviews.text: Now the negatives... The food was just ok. For the most part it was buffet as per usual a.I. accept that you are only allowed to eat at 2 restaurants a week that aren't buffet. The seafood and Japanese restraurants we ate at were very good but by the end of the week, the buffet was just so tired we had a hard time eating there. The buffets down by the ocean for lunch were ok but not good. I'm not real picky but I like my burger to at least be cooked... the check in was fine other than the fact that we arrived early and a lot of others did also but no rooms were given until 3p so that made for a line and a wait for a room assignment. No biggie but would have been nice to check in a little early... the entertainment at nights was ok but not great. didnt try the disco, we are not the dancing type. If your looking for a nightlife this is not the place for you. .The last negative I have may be a little skewed I don't really know. I never got good service at the swim up bars. It took forever to get a drink. Others around me didnt seems to have as much problems as I did especially the hispanic ones and my wife, who is hot never had a problem ,but my white male self had a real problem getting served at times.. ..
reviews.title: Very nice place to stay and had a blast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall this was a very good vacation at a very good place and a very good price, and we are considering coming back, The drive from the airport is over an hour but the location is almost worth the drive. I probably would stay in playacar if the money is close.
reviews.title: Barcelo Maya Beach & Caribe

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One last thing, the beach end of the resort is the cheapest of 4 resorts in 1 ...the most expensive is the Palace at the opposite end. They share a beach and ocean frontage, The beach has the best "beach" the rest of the accommodations go up from beach to Palace. If this bothers you that your are staying at the cheapest of the hotels you may want to consider that. Personally, getting most of what the Palace offers with a better beach and a lot cheaper is worth it to me. Some might feel like 2nd class but didn't bother me.
reviews.title: Beautuful property

reviews.text: I stayed here from 7/2/2012-7/09/12. I would like to say I wasn't really sure what to expect on going to this resort...I definatley loved this resort, and don't really have many negative things to say about it. I have been to other resorts like the Iberostars in Riviera Maya and Cozumel. Barcelo is very similar to Iberostar in many ways. I did prefer the pool and beach areas much better here than at any of the Iberostars. The pools are much larger and seem to be a little more fun. The beaches are a lot larger here and are less rough, as it is in a lagoon. The beach go-ers were also better looking here too. There was more a lot of fish/wildlife/snorkleing available right off the pier that was on the resort. You can get fish food and feed them. The rooms were nice, but the a/c power will turn off once you leave your room, which can make the room get warm rather quickly. The food was about par for being at an all inclusive, but the restaraunts were pretty good. I didn't like the fact that in order to purchase anything from the gift shops, that you had to charge the room as apposed to paying with cash. The resort was huge, and you have to do a lot of walking. i really only went to one of the shows for the night entertainment and think the Iberostars do a little bit better of a job at that. The club was a little bit better than the Iberostars. The rooms would sometimes have little bugs either on the bed or on the floor. The mini fridge wasn't all that cold either. I think that the atomosphere/beach/pool totally made the trip though. The staff was very nice, and I would recommend this place to couples, groups, or families. I would go back for sure.
reviews.title: Loved Our Stay

reviews.text: I read these reviews a lot but this is my first time writing one - I felt compelled to do so.
reviews.title: June 21 - July 5 : good but not great

reviews.text: We had a late departure with Sunwing and arrived 5 hrs late but the check-in went smoothly. The hotel is about 1 hr from Cancun airport.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!

reviews.text: Beach:
reviews.title: I have to stop writing such good reviews…I have let out the secret.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beach is very wide with lots of loungers available. There are lots of palm trees (but no palapas here) so finding shade is not an issue. You don't have to do the early morning lounger ritual as you will find them at any time. The Maya Beach section has the nicest beach - less rocky than the sister hotels. But you still may need water shoes if you go further in.
reviews.title: Deserves a 4Star Plus Rating

reviews.text: Restaurants:
reviews.title: Great multi-generational vacation

reviews.text: From check in to check out 14 days not a single problem,respect and follow the hotels policies and procedures it's not complicated. Will return many more times to the Barcelo maya beach and especially as you have access to the tropical,caribe and colonial's pools /waterpark/beaches and theatre. Hope this review helps and my wife and I are a younger couple of 29 and 30 years old with a 2year old son. Will be back for another 2weeks in August!
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before booking your reservation through Book-It (or any other travel agent), make sure you clearly note what kind of beds you want (2 queens vs. 1 king). Neglected to do that and it took an hour to get checked in, even though they were not fully booked...
reviews.title: Hotel Beautiful, but Sunwing Vacations a Nightmare!!!

reviews.text: If you have the resort credits--note that the $200 cannot be used as you see fit. You have $30 for Internet, $10 for laundry, $40 for the spa, $10 for kids spa, $60 for dinner on the beach, $30 for wine, and $20 for room service. Keep in mind that the credit doesn't completely cover the cost of the service--unless you only have 1 or 2 things that need to be laundered. I had elected to have a massage-- but I couldn't use the spa voucher towards a 25-minute reflexology massage--had to be a service of 50 minutes or more--so you wind up spending at least $40 out of pocket...
reviews.title: Maya Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was a magic resort, lovely staff, rooms and extraordinary beach!!
reviews.title: 2008 holidays
three generations of cruisers decided on land vacation
reviews.text: Three generations of travelers went sept. 2011. i decided on this resort after cancelling three resorts due to bad reviews. i booked my parents directly through barcelo.com web site seniors promotion was 50% off. i booked mine through bookit.com both were around $1000 total per room not per person. i work for delta airlines so air was free. we love to cruise and i was worried about pleasing everyone. senior parents, husband and two girls 7 & 9. the resort was empty, mostly europeans, (smoking) everywhere. i started talking to a girl at the pool bar, we were excited to hear each anothers american accent. the pools are fabulous, tons of swim up bars with lots of seats. i did not like the pool entertainment, young man kept screaming in all different languages on his microphone. we hung out at the tropical and palace pools. we loved the hammocks and the pools. the beach is fabulous. they could us new pool towels, instead of faded burgundy ones. you had to turn in used one to get new one and use towel cards. my kids stayed in the pool till 7. i think they closed to 10pm. i've never seen bigger pools, tons of hammocks and chairs. we didn't use any sports equipment. we never engaged in any pool activities or beach sports. i love that stuff and just didn't see anything going on. entertainment around pools and beach pretty much non-existent. i think what got me the most, i didn't get any employee names, they were not engaging. the food was ok, breakfast the best and i liked lunch huts near the pools. restaurants were ok, rooms ok. entertainment at night ok. we left resort twice once to x-hela and playa del carmen. took a cab to x-hela but collectivo to pdc. you can take collective $3 p/p all the way to tulum or cancun. i would never take taxi again, expensive and scary, cab drivers were fighting over the fare and trapped us between their cars. would i go back to barcelo maya beach? yes, price was great would try eating at playa del carmen restaurants or puerto aventuras for a change of taste. i was worried about getting bored (we dont need to be enertained.) i brought pool toys, floats and card games. everyone loved getting drinks anytime, pour yourself Corona was great, bungee jumping at 4pm everyday. my kids were the only kids at the kids club (we stayed with them.) the resorts were so beautiful it was very relaxing compared to a cruise vacation. we didn't need a vacation after a vacation. i did bring extra hangers, a pop up hamper, lots of one dollar bills, pool floats, small flash lights and mexican themed decorations for our room door. maids thought they were cute. we learned it helps our senior parents and kids find our room easier and husband if he's had too much to drink. overall an excellent vacation. can't beat pools and beach, best i've ever been to.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We visited May 26-June 2. Weather was a bit rainy but that didn't stop us from having a good time. This is the first time my husband and I went without kids. This resort is made up of the following and we have stayed at all of them. You can use most of the facilities at all of them no matter which one you stay at. They are in order of least expensive to most expensive
reviews.title: 4th stay here, great as usual

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 1. The Maya Beach
reviews.title: We WILL go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2. The Maya Caribe
reviews.title: we loved every minute...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have absolutely nothing bad to say about this resort!! The staff was the friendliest that we have ever encountered in all of our trips. The beach is awesome, the rooms are clean and the bed is even comfortable! The mini bar is stocked daily and you can get cold water thru out the resort which is something you don't see!! Say hi to Pedro in the pool bar and Abraham in the morning buffet from the tattoo guy with the fangs! Will definitely go back to this resort. Check out the shopping plaza, it was great too!
reviews.title: AWESOME PLACE

reviews.text: Highly recommend Dolphin Discovery as an excursion. Everyone there is great including the dolphins, manatees and sea lions!! Say hi to Andrea for me!
reviews.title: Not really all inclusive

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fabulous resort, lovely and clean, however this resort doesn't cater for British, the food is ok but very repetitive, lunch is normally better than dinner, all the restaurants except the Spanish are poor, at the steak restaurant they ask how u want your steak, but just cook it blue regardless of what u ask for, lovely presentation tho, the Mexican is terrible, the food is cold and bland how can they get Mexican wrong in Mexico ?? Lol. If u don't upgrade then u are very limited to restaurants unless u pay extra, all branded drinks are off also, I did upgrade but was a bit annoyed that after 17 hours of traveling it was the first question I was asked on arrival also if u don't upgrade and want internet connection then it will be an extra $3 per day, the hotel doesn't seem to miss a trick in ways to get your money, it is worth upgrading tho as u get 10% off everything u buy in the hotel including trips but only when u book through the hotel and not the reps, expect to tip from the moment u get off the plane till the moment u get back on the plane, sometimes u won't get served at the bar unless u tip, all the drinks are poor quality and very watered down, I find it best to get spirits out of my VIP area to top up the drinks from the bar.
reviews.title: Good value!

reviews.text: Lastly expect to get bitten, the mosquitos are terrible bring plugs etc with u, don't bother with sprays, it seems to attract them.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.text: We have never been to Mexico before. We stayed here for a belated honeymoon and did not know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. The pools were huge, drinks were good, buffets were better than I expected, good shopping and beautiful beaches. We booked through FunJet and I would use them again. They assign you a personal representative once you get there to help you plan your vacation and make reservations for attractions. He even called us to remind us about our flight info on our last night there. The only bad thing I can say is that our room was pretty hot at times. But the ceiling fan seemed to help when the air conditioning didn't keep up. Overall I think our experience was a good value for what we paid.
reviews.title: Amazing resort couldn't ask for anything else!!
